content: On October 2, 1993, the Atlanta Braves clinched the National League East title with a 4-0 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies at Veterans Stadium. This win marked the Braves' second consecutive division championship and solidified their dominance in the National League during the early '90s. Tom Glavine pitched a stellar game, throwing a complete shutout and striking out 10 batters, showcasing the strength of the Braves' pitching staff that season.
